title: Oh honey, NO: AOC like totally embarrasses herself tweeting out her own definitions of socialism versus capitalism and LOL
text:
Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez couldn’t wait to tweet out the differences between socialism and capitalism … or the cost of capitalism … or something.

You know what? We’re not even sure what the Hell she’s trying to say here but it’s probably safe to assume she is saying socialism is good and capitalism is bad.

When the public democratically decides to invest in ourselves, in working people, they call it socialism. When a billionaire-captured government forces the public to pay for their misdeeds at the expense of working people, they just call it the cost of capitalism. https://t.co/nUgMpRBiYB — Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (@AOC) September 23, 2019

AOC, that’s not how this works.

That’s not how any of this works.

Thankfully, we're not a democracy; which is aptly described as 2 wolves and a sheep making dinner plans. But to your broader point, it is indeed wrong to have government intervene in the market. GM should have been allowed to go under. Ditto Chrysler and Ma and Pa Kettle's farm. — Redcloak the Unruly (@BrewingAle) September 23, 2019

Humans can't survive without food. Humans can survive without cars. Big difference. — Carolina (@RealappraiserSC) September 23, 2019

But this editor loves her GMC …

Someone needs to teach you the definition of socialism… pic.twitter.com/SsaBLwbQmH — Constitutionalist (@n2conservatism) September 23, 2019

Oh, why even bother at this point?

No, when you FORCE people to pay for everyone else they call it socialism. Fixed it for you. 😘 — Deal With It (@thelegendarykel) September 23, 2019

Apparently, investing in ourselves means giving the keys of the country to an ex-bartender sock puppet who's proven to be terrible at just about everything except Twitter. — Don't Fredo me, bro (@IMatriculator) September 23, 2019

Oh my, someone skipped their classes at BU. — Mickey Zhivago (@MickeyZhivago) September 23, 2019

Indeed.

Oh honey. America has NEVER voted in any way to go to socialism!! Who told you that. — Happy Hillbilly (@hillbilly_happy) September 23, 2019

Everyone agrees government and corporations are in bed at the expense of people everywhere. Everyone also agrees that socialism is not the answer, not is wanted by the American people. The two are not mutually exclusive. — John Crowe (@mutinypictures) September 23, 2019

If you applied this same energy to ensuring and enhancing opportunity instead of redistribution via govt… you might actually be able to do some good. — PkrBum (@PkrBum) September 23, 2019

But then she wouldn’t be able to write edgy tweets about socialism and stuff!

description: AOC, that's not how this works. That's not how any of this works.
